entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French pardun, pardoun, from parduner

def.dt: :the excusing of an offense without exacting a penalty
:a release from the legal penalties of an offense
:an official warrant of remission of penalty
:excuse or forgiveness for a fault, offense, or discourtesy I beg your pardon

entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French parduner, from Late Latin perdonare to grant freely, from Latin per- thoroughly + donare to give parboil, donation

def.dt: :to absolve from the consequences of a fault or crime
:to allow (an offense) to pass without punishment :forgive
:to relieve of a penalty improperly assessed
